What are some of the differences between purchasing bonds and purchasing stocks?

resprocessing.qticomment: Paragraph Question can not be scored with standard response processing. This is my human rater.

material.mattext: When you buy a bond, the money invested must be repaid on the due date. Stock investments do not have to be repaid. A stockholder is an owner of the company, whereas a bond owner is considered a lender. Investors in bonds receive interest payments as income, but stockholders do not. They receive dividends, or shares of the company’s profit. Investors in stocks run a higher risk of losing part or all of their investment. Bond holders will receive the par value of the bonds they purchased on the due date.

material.mattext: Why should consumers be wary of the statistics they hear or read?

resprocessing.qticomment: Paragraph Question can not be scored with standard response processing. This is my human rater.

material.mattext: Almost any viewpoint can be “supported” by statistics by using those that back up the viewpoint while ignoring those that do not. Statistics are used in this way all the time by organizations to make their claims appear credible. To believe the statistics used by others, you need to know how all the data were collected and analyzed. Then you can determine the truthfulness of the statistics.

material.mattext: When a business is declared bankrupt, what steps are taken to pay the business’ debts?

resprocessing.qticomment: Paragraph Question can not be scored with standard response processing. This is my human rater.

material.mattext: The court appoints a trustee to sell all the assets. The proceeds from the assets first go to pay the legal costs of the bankruptcy. They also go to any claims that the law says must be paid first and to any secured creditors, such as a bank holding a mortgage. Any money left over goes to all other creditors in proportion to their claims.

What is the difference between weight and mass?

resprocessing.qticomment: Paragraph Question can not be scored with standard response processing. This is my human rater.

material.mattext: Mass is a measurement of the quantity of matter, whereas weight is a force exerted by gravitational pull against a mass. When speaking of items on earth however, the two are often used interchangeably.
What are some of the consequences of a country having a large trade deficit?

resprocessing.qticomment: Paragraph Question can not be scored with standard response processing. This is my human rater.

material.mattext: The country may have to borrow money or ask for credit from other countries. This introduces foreign debt and the country must pay interest on the money borrowed. Also, foreign debt can affect a country’s economy by limiting the amount of money available for necessary work in the country.
